intro: Stylosanthes floridana, commonly known as Florida stylo, is a flowering plant native to the southeastern United States. It is a legume, belonging to the family Fabaceae, and is characterized by its trifoliate leaves and small, yellowish-white flowers. The plant is often found in sandy soils and can thrive in coastal areas due to its salt tolerance. It plays an important role in soil stabilization and is used in forage and erosion control.
